page.title: 08GAWTHORP'S FARM
page.content: The Gawthorps have a Dairy herd.Half our milk goes to the dairy and the other half we bottle and sell to the people of Calverley from our own milk round.We buy cows at Otley market either milk cows at three or four years old or calves to rear.We have one bull who is twelve years old We feed them both hay and silage which we have made earlier in the year.Hay is important to cattle because it has vitamin C to help them produce milk. We have over fifty acres of land and half that amount is used for grazing cattle on. The other half is used for growing crops such as potatoes,turnips,carrots,peas and other vegetables. The farm is run by ten people each having their own job to do from ploughing a field to selling the milk.
